stream_context.summary: Kaze live-debugs a severe crash in a new temple side-area, refines its platforming and visuals, and discusses the next major world (“Quest 13” – an ice-castle on a mountain).  He also reviews Wild West signage that Zeina drew and tweaks textures, lighting, and collision throughout the session.

development_findings.summary: Fixed a rare crash when entering the new side-area: his optimisation stored the current object pointer in the FP/S8 register; a swimming function overwrote S8, corrupting the pointer.  He removed S8 from that routine, eliminating the crash.
development_findings.quote: By my calculations, we should now be rid of the crash.

development_findings.summary: Decided to scrap and rebuild a ‘boring’ red-coin sub-area after watching play-testers struggle; new layout splits geometry into two rooms, adds safer collision and clearer coin paths.
development_findings.quote: We’re just remaking one area of an old level because I watched play-testers play it and realised this area fucking sucks.

development_findings.summary: Quest 13 concept locked in: an ice-castle atop a mountain, bright desaturated blues and whites, ‘suspenseful’ rather than dark, with possible aurora in an outdoor section; still no boss idea.
development_findings.quote: It’s going to be very gloomy and scary… actually more suspenseful.  White and desaturated blues – bright but scary.

development_findings.summary: Lighting/texture pass on moving brick platforms: added multi-texture ‘scuffed’ bricks, per-platform fog shading, and cut hard edges to help them blend with temple palette.
Water physics keep velocity when entering, unlike vanilla SM64; per-area coloured splash effects are planned.
development_findings.quote: Look how nice the speed transitions… it’s actually like jumping off a thing – way better than vanilla.

development_findings.summary: Engine will be released open-source once game is done.
development_findings.quote: Will the engine be open source?  Yes it will be.

development_findings.summary: Performance rule: over-draw is a bigger concern than triangle count, so temple walls are closed meshes even if it costs geometry.
development_findings.quote: Overdraw is much more of a concern than triangles.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s wife Zeina accidentally shaved a bald line, forcing him to adopt a very short ‘military’ haircut.
context_findings.quote: The front thing of the clippers came off and she just kept going… so we had to cut it short.

context_findings.summary: Maintains rigorous workouts (bench behind him, daily lifting); currently managing a knee injury, so leg training is limited.
context_findings.quote: I can deadlift like 500 pounds, but my squat has fallen behind because my knee injury has been there all the time.

context_findings.summary: Skeptical of doctors after poor experiences; prefers self-led physio and research.
context_findings.quote: Every time I go to a doctor it gets worse, so I do not go to doctors anymore.

context_findings.summary: Philosophical aside: expects future generations to judge meat-eaters harshly; would quit meat if he became immortal.
context_findings.quote: People in the future will fucking hate me.

context_findings.summary: Acknowledges YouTube metrics obsessively; excited when a video on invisible walls performs well but worries about possible drop-off.
context_findings.quote: Surely this will still drop down to 10th place.  Who would want to watch a stupid video like mine?

biobak.summary: Provided texture/layout feedback, teasing Lilaa about Wild West lighting and suggesting structural replacements for over-used cranes.

zeina.summary: Created new signage textures for Course 12 (‘Tumbleweed Store’, ‘Koopa Bank’, and ‘Milk Bar’); Kaze requests full-res versions for N64-safe sizing.
zeina.quote: Zaina just did a sign for a tumbleweed store… the milk bar sign is really good.

zeina.summary: Cuts Kaze’s hair; personal life crosses into dev stream.

key_stories.title: S8 Register Crash
key_stories.summary: A newly built temple room crashed when Mario hit a wall.  Kaze traced it to his custom optimisation that stores the current object pointer in the FP/S8 register; a swim routine overwrote S8.  Removing S8 usage fixed the bug live on stream.
key_stories.process: Reviewed disassembly, identified S8 misuse, edited code to eliminate S8 in compiled output.
key_stories.key_quote: This function overwrites the S8 register with some random local variable, so my current object pointer gets overwritten.

key_stories.title: Replacing a ‘Boring’ Red-Coin Mission
key_stories.summary: After observing testers, Kaze deemed an older red-coin room tedious.  He showcased the old version, outlined its faults (slow vines, awkward camera), then began rebuilding a tighter, two-room variant with better sliding and coin flow.
key_stories.challenge: Old mission was dull and camera-unfriendly.
key_stories.process: Analyzed tester footage, deleted room, blocked out new geometry, adjusted collision and coin spacing on stream.
key_stories.outcome: New design nearly complete; collision tweaks remain.
key_stories.key_quote: I watched play-testers play it and realised this area fucking sucks.

key_stories.title: Imagining Quest 13 – The Ice Castle
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstormed the next major world: a bright, desaturated ice castle high on a mountain, inspired by his own Hollow Root Keep from The Missing Link.  Palette, mood, and outdoor aurora are set, but boss ideas are open.
key_stories.process: Discussed colors, lighting (avoid generic darkness), cited Zelda influences, debated daytime vs gloomy with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Concept locked; art direction clear; gameplay and boss TBD.
key_stories.key_quote: Yes, I’m going to be using my own game as inspiration. What you gonna do about it?
